alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, Pulaski and southwestern Rockcastle Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Gum Sulphur to near Jamestown. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Gum Sulphur, Indian Lakes Park and Ottowa around 100 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Naomi, Monticello, Lake Linville, Maretburg, Spiro, Mount Vernon, Mill Springs, Betsey, Steubenville, Frazer, Burr, Pine Hill, Wellhope, Kidder and Sinks. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 55 and 62. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 35. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
